intro: Espeletia leucactina, commonly known as the white-flowered espeletia, is a striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy white flower heads. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the cold, dry conditions of the Andean páramo ecosystem. Its flowers are typically visited by various pollinators, including bees and moths, contributing to its ecological significance. Espeletia leucactina is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
